criteria: Understanding of pedestrian safety rules and regulations.
Ability to identify safe crossing locations.
Awareness of potential hazards and defensive strategies.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of pedestrian safety rules.
Shows limited awareness of basic pedestrian safety rules.
Identifies some pedestrian safety rules but with inaccuracies.
Understands most pedestrian safety rules but misses some details.
Clearly understands pedestrian safety rules and regulations.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of pedestrian safety rules and regulations, including local laws.
Unable to identify any safe crossing locations.
Identifies crossing locations randomly without consideration for safety.
Identifies some safe crossing locations, but also includes unsafe locations.
Usually identifies safe crossing locations, but makes occasional errors.
Consistently identifies appropriate and safe crossing locations.
Expertly identifies the safest crossing locations considering multiple factors (visibility, traffic flow, signals).
Does not demonstrate any safe street-crossing procedures.
Attempts street-crossing procedures unsafely and incorrectly.
Demonstrates some elements of safe crossing, but misses key steps.
Follows most of the safe crossing procedure with minor omissions.
Follows the complete safe crossing procedure correctly and consistently.
Executes safe street-crossing flawlessly, adapting to various conditions (e.g., traffic, weather).
Shows no awareness of potential hazards while crossing the street.
Demonstrates minimal awareness of common hazards.
Recognizes some hazards but does not react appropriately.
Identifies most hazards and attempts some defensive strategies.
Consistently identifies hazards and employs effective defensive strategies.
Anticipates potential hazards and proactively uses defensive strategies to ensure safety in all situations.
